title: PM Modi: Will not forget Uri attack - Mumbai Mirror -
body:
Kozhikode: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Saturday squarely targetted Pakistan, saying India will not forget the sacrifices of 18 soldiers killed in the Uri terror attack and will work to isolate Pakistan globally for exporting terro

Addressing the BJP National Council meet here, Modi said that the Pakistan government was "misleading" its people on Kashmir.

He said Pakistani leaders had been talking of a "thousand years' war" with India. "Let me tell you that there is a government in Delhi that accepts your challenge."

However, he mellowed down the rhetoric, saying both countries should "fight the war", but against poverty, unemployment and illiteracy -- and "let's see who wins".

"The people of Pakistan should ask their rulers... PoK (Pakistan Occupied Kashmir) is with you, you can't even manage that. Earlier, East Pakistan, now Bangladesh, was with you, you could not manage that. You are unable to manage PoK, Sindh, Gilgit- Baltistan and Balochistan, and you are talking of Kashmir... They are misleading you on Kashmir," he said.

Modi said he wanted to remind the people of Pakistan that before Partition in 1947, their forefathers also considered this land as their own.

"I want to speak to the people of Pakistan. I want to remind them that before 1947 your forefathers too used to consider this country as your motherland, worship it. Keeping that in mind I want to ask a few things."

He said both countries became independent at the same time. "So how is it that India exports software, but you (Pakistan) export terrorists."

He also said the "Sacrifice of 18 soldiers" killed in the Uri attack "will not go in vain".

"We will make efforts to isolate Pakistan" and force it to remain alone in the global stage".

Earlier in his speech, Modi said there is one nation in Asia which does not want peace or development.

"There is one country which is exporting terrorism in the world from Asia."

He said that terrorism is affecting India's neighbours, including Afghanistan and Bangladesh.

"In the world when reports of terrorism come, then this news also follows that the terrorists came from that (neighbouring) country, or like Osama bin Laden, have found a hideout there."

He said Indian forces were giving befitting reply to all terror acts.

title: Pak exports terror, we software: PM - Mumbai Mirror -
body:
PM Narendra Modi at the public meeting at Kozhikode beach on SaturdaySpeaking for the first time after the Uri attack, Modi gives a blistering answer to Pakistan, says its people will fight their own govt.

NEW DELHI Adopting a new tactic, Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Saturday, lashed out at Pakistan over the Uri terror attack. Accusing the country of 'exporting terror', he said that Pakistan had elected a government that was working with the 'terror masterminds'.

Launching a blistering attack on Pakistan in his first public address after last Sunday's deadly terror attack, he said the sacrifice of 18 soldiers will not go in vain while all out efforts will be made to isolate that country globally. Modi was speaking at a largely-attended public meeting on the Kozhikode beach held on the sidelines of the BJP national council meet.

"India exports software, Pakistan exports terror," said Modi, pointing out that both the countries became independent in 1947. "And a day will come when people of Pakistan will go against their own government to fight terrorism," he added.

'Soldiers' sacrifice not wasted'

Sensing the growing demand for retaliatory military action against the neighboring country, Modi admitted to the seething anger and said, "Rulers of Pakistan listen, the sacrifice of 18 soldiers will not go waste. India has been successful in isolating you. We will force you to be left alone in the world."

Referring to remarks of former Pakistani leaders of fighting a 1,000 year war with India, Modi said: "There is a government in Delhi today which is ready to accept the challenge."

Without naming Pakistan's premier Nawaz Sharif, Modi said that the words of the elected government in Pakistan are of little value as he "reads out whatever patrons of terror in his country ask him to."

Reaching out to the people of Pakistan, Modi said, "Today, I am speaking to the people of Pakistan. From the leaders who read speeches written by terrorists, the world can expect nothing. I want to remind Pakistan about the time before 1947 when their ancestors used to consider the undivided India their land and worshipped it. But your leaders have PoK which they haven't been able to manage."
source.title: Mumbai Mirror
